DE4C5B0EEDFD49D49E3ADDEFE90E6E10.description: Recognize and analyse how music is used in everyday lives (e.g., video games, films, social media, apps).

DE08C502A2C547E48664FE70F8388B84.description: Conduct an inquiry into how change (e.g., personal, social, technology) influences musical works.

C3EECC7C9F8343C1B56053D5F30BB800.description: Research influential musical educators and their programs and methods (e.g., Kodaly, JohnBaptiste Arcand, Orff, Buffy Sainte-Marie, Jose Antonio Abreu).

A3B4390BB2094C45B11008364206B9AF.description: Examine how music and musicians influence and respond to social, political and cultural issues (e.g., world music, music concerned with human rights, environmental sustainability).

3CD07340540F493498F2D5A63108872B.description: Investigate why notable musicians and their work are/were influential (e.g., current, historical, community, representing gender and sexual diversity).

CC19C48C965E41B19330486427DB345B.description: Identify, listen to and discuss the work of musicians who have made an impact on music.

DF3CEA44E29B4A96A1131EFA22343E7F.description: Examine the work and impact of influential local, Canadian and international musicians.

CF313DDAE9A14303A58BBF04A7F75F39.description: Discuss entrepreneurship and personal qualities required for pursuing a career in music.

9D64990068CA4A4D90B2501CBBF7EB79.description: Research supports for musicians such as unions, professional associations, agents, Elders and Knowledge Keepers, provincial and federal grants (e.g., funding for creation, touring and recording).

2C48845C22B242E78EA877939B4552C6.description: Examine ethics (e.g., copying pirated music files, sampling, compensation from streaming services, stereotyped representations in lyrics and music videos) and legalities (e.g., copyrighting, trademarking, First Nations traditional laws, contracts) related to creating and producing music.

3A11611A6089434380027694851259DE.description: Examine legalities in music such as copyrighting, trademarking and contracts (e.g., performance contract fees, licensing and financial compensation for digital distribution of recordings, First Nations traditional laws).

2F0C4CF0E8DE445AB6DD742923F73649.description: Generate questions and conduct an inquiry into potential career avenues in specific disciplines and music in general (e.g., audio engineer, DJ, orchestral musician, composer/songwriter, producer, music therapist) and investigate opportunities for continuing study at the postsecondary level (e.g., scholarships, entrance requirements, auditions).

2B3B8C527A254F13BD1F78BDF7078D88.description: Explore music from own cultural heritage and examine opportunities and benefits for continuing lifelong engagement in music (e.g., community choirs, bands, musical theatre).

6A1B87DB63DA438B9C3AB799079BB707.description: Examine how music is infused in daily life (e.g., to influence consumers via advertising, shopping environments, cultural music festivals) including media (e.g., film, video games, television, social media, apps).

5190408592214A0386DC1FF0AB4F6A03.description: Examine ways that different genres/styles of music influence one’s wellbeing (e.g., rock music elevating moods, ballads encouraging reflection or relaxation).

973335D2B2B04F278C0254EA9EA078FC.description: Investigate relationships between music and personal wellness including mental health (e.g., music therapy, social connection) and identify and discuss associated research.

CE7E35F95FF74AE88874F7DF02C065B7.description: Examine the impact and role of music in own life and investigate music careers and pathways for continuing engagement in music.

1CD88FAC72474611B92E08DFAC180494.description: Investigate and perform music from around the world (e.g., Afro Caribbean, South American, Middle Eastern), describe characteristics of each genre and style, and discuss the infusion or influence of non-western music in contemporary western popular music.

692A85DC2E794E57AA21EBE803B27E92.description: Examine ways in which audience responses in different musical genres affect the musician’s performance and the audience’s experience.

69068DDEDA174A6292FCB0796B958A73.description: Investigate the origins of performance and audience etiquette (e.g., clapping following jazz solos, silence between symphonic movements) in different genres of music.

5289C431C13248D89EB4746BBCAD1776.description: Anticipate and prepare for how audiences might react to the music performed in relation to, for example, venue, genre, demographics or type of event.

2229E16334854C7780BAC1ED92FB6411.description: Respond as an audience member and perform in a manner appropriate to the genre (e.g., First Nations powwow, symphony, world music, jazz, African or Latin percussion group, rock band) respecting cultural and performance norms and protocols (e.g., deportment, attire, respect for local tradition, await invitation to join jam session, bowing, encore, standing during Grand Entry and Honour songs and anthems, etiquette concerning use of cameras and recording devices).

DAE44D418D9D434E8245CBB9AE6A09D1.description: Explain audience and performer norms and protocols within the genre.

229BD1F9B1414DE0B0A608E51153C48B.description: Explore the evolution of instruments, voice and creative technologies and their use in various cultures and time periods.

5BBB270700764FD1B9C1D5237EA6FBF1.description: Conduct an inquiry into how music from the past is recreated today, or how music of today can be reinterpreted in styles from the past.

02F2FAF61ADE424ABD97D02D49C34E68.description: Investigate the influence of personal experience and cultural and historical contexts on the creation of selected music

88B8E2012F4B4665845099ADA25BD450.description: Identify musical, cultural, aural, textual clues that indicate the music’s place in time.

6AF9CF122E9A45BF931134F927DE9B51.description: Aurally distinguish and describe characteristics of the different eras, genres and styles through researching, listening to and/or performing the representative music.

086497EE3AD54B5BA545196FF1D41EFE.description: Cultural/Historical (CH) Goal: Students will investigate the content and aesthetics of the arts within cultural, historical, and contemporary contexts, and understand the connection between the arts and the human experience.

5A0CDCBE2113477CB331789F38AFA62C.description: Conduct an inquiry into ways technology (e.g., microphones, software, pedals) and materials (e.g., drum heads, mutes, baffles, curtains) can manipulate sound.

BB0CCC50C41647F8985DBADD929F9DAD.description: Apply techniques to improve sound quality through care and maintenance of instruments and/or voices.

861798463706445A939793CA1139674C.description: Explore ways in which technology, acoustics, equipment (e.g., instruments, accessories, amplification systems, acoustical designs, technologies) and personal wellness impacts quality of sound.

8E032CC1DD1B42A6A73C0DF5FBBE11F8.description: Make personal connections to the music, understanding how personal preference impacts critical analysis, and provide reasons for individual preferences.

B842CADBC4004C009DEA58EB7B3F21BB.description: Analyse and interpret music, examine the importance of musical text using evidence from the piece and/or performance.

692EA37259B9488EAFCAF0BD4E0FDE73.description: Analyse the characteristics of excellent performance through listening to and watching other performers.

DBE3AFFA608543BFBB62CE1272308A9D.description: Respond critically (e.g., written, oral, arts expression) to music from various genres, styles, times, places, social groups and cultures, using terminology specific to the music genre.

E77ECB78B65649F8B5F5513185CA9D83.description: Examine and classify music representing various genres, styles, time periods, places, social groups, world cultures, composers and performers.

D6C1340E57E04228B5422B6E46E43915.description: Express initial reactions, while listening to music, and conduct further analysis based on evidence in the work.

C44D807B95D849FDAEE299EEB4832457.description: Listen and respond to musical expressions of others, understanding how personal preference impacts critical analysis.

BB64FA9821F54D70955D6135AF8DDDE8.description: Generate a plan for musical growth using technical inquiry findings (e.g., In what ways could I/we record progress? How could I improve my musical performance using specific tools, technologies and techniques?).

F87B4FBD02A14B14B4B9EA8CEBD3F2EC.description: Respond to musical elements such as tone, pitch, dynamics, intonation, phrasing, style, rhythm and time, within own musical expressions.

ED4ED16F53A6449FA40250D40938AE05.description: Examine own musical expressions, using peer feedback and self-assessment, in order to improve.

C18C2E87D2ED45659D52C224B22B07E7.description: Listen and respond critically to own musical expressions and, with guidance, implement a plan for musical growth.

D32F3D7161C64E288DAFA6C46A1C04DD.description: Examine regional and/or stylistic differences in Métis music including among individuals and groups.

5D8FDF3E522F456C8975D8EC007D1A11.description: Examine how Métis music and musicians in Saskatchewan influence arts and cultural communities.

3D89E21102464031AB72234F54B2AB8E.description: Respond to the music of selected Saskatchewan Métis musicians

8F488CCDDE0F4DADA4FC55AA6E94225F.description: Recognize how specific selections of contemporary Métis musicians are influenced by tradition.

5BC4E560BA8B45FAB8A75F16E5CE1BA5.description: Describe qualities of traditional and contemporary Métis music

BA87AAB7D81B4A8F8053FB693ADB219F.description: Engage with Métis musicians to examine characteristics of Métis music.

4C413304B86D4AF4898F8BD672CB4072.description: Identify and describe characteristics of the music of Saskatchewan Métis peoples.

319257DC6ADA448292A3EF0CA33410B5.description: Identify differences in music and protocols among First Nations.

7E35597A4AFA452987773A0ADC2F7BB9.description: Identify the purpose of the different roles of men and women in traditional drumming and singing.

C2B30B7E6A7F4E67BC530A4680CCB787.description: Describe various powwow protocols and their purposes, including protocols specific to the music.

B1EE4FF6F30A41C2A2AAF69EEA096911.description: Recognize different purposes for First Nations ceremonial and social music.

AF44E55E8BE9442FA302EFF93B8A0389.description: Examine how First Nations music and musicians from Saskatchewan and international locations influence and respond to social, political and cultural issues (e.g., treaty education outcome SI11 - analyze how the unfulfilled aspects of treaties, with international Indigenous people, have resulted in inequities).

8CCC18AE044B45FCB249F39E88F62BD5.description: Analyze how the work of contemporary musicians is influenced by First Nations traditional music.

93553CBFCF4F444C81921434DA8AEF4E.description: Discuss the ways of knowing and learning (e.g., songs passed down/gifted, songs composed) that are applied to learning First Nations traditional and contemporary music.

9813A9E05D1E4BBC9F9A01143C1EBFB0.description: Engage with First Nations Elders, Knowledge Keepers and/or musicians to identify characteristics of music associated with various powwow dances (e.g., fancy dance, men’s and women’s traditional, jingle dress).

2D03322C0EDB41B3BFBB1210867F5BAA.description: Identify and describe characteristics of powwow and other social music of Saskatchewan First Nations peoples.

4BDA5F1B0D704237B907578A5F44EEDA.description: Critical/Responsive (CR) Goal: Students will respond to artistic expressions of Saskatchewan, Canadian, and International artists using critical thinking, research, creativity, and collaborative inquiry.

1CB6FDF5E82C4DEB9FDC6885E34DBB0A.description: Seek opportunities to improvise in daily music experiences (e.g., during song writing, digital music composition, DJ and hip hop performance, jam solos).

56AE964FAA9E4CAAB33644FC43862049.description: Apply language appropriate to the musical style to talk about improvisation.

59656264411043F2A3E54F8547384C05.description: Imitate or transcribe more complex musical ideas (e.g., listen and play).

DD6FA0F9D1D7428D81A62257B67C84C5.description: Demonstrate increased knowledge of selected musical concepts (e.g., elements of music, composition principles) through improvisation.

538F3C8656854964A336429A478EA0E7.description: Take personal and musical risks by trying new ways to express ideas.

9590D66EE89844A8A20584619493878C.description: Demonstrate growth in the presentation and construction of improvised solos in a live setting.

C2368D95F7B24C268DA3584C66B73A36.description: Examine the work of musicians engaged in improvisation and begin to apply learning to own musical work.

294202E603F8491C9CEC35736B6832A3.description: Examine improvisation within a diverse range of cultural and social contexts.

74437AF65DC64609B4DE70E876A86B7A.description: Use feedback to inform decision making, evaluation and action in improvisation.

DA08E65A4BDA4700BEC4989BED922DB8.description: Improvise on an instrument or with voice or other creative technology, implementing increased levels of music theory, cultural or performance practice.

C08FAC699DA7477B9168434520D8B94B.description: Apply increased aural skills to making musical decisions for sound compositions.

EDC60C331B1E4A0E9384055024B1DC70.description: Demonstrate, through rehearsal, an ability to reflect on, refine and revise solo and ensemble compositions.

FDD11A9848FC450E94687BB4FDAB8B91.description: Demonstrate ability to apply the elements of music (i.e., melody, harmony, rhythm, dynamics, form, tone, texture) and principles of composition (e.g., repetition and variation, tension and resolution, balance and unity).

B64399A0E5AD44FE9F9A1555C02906C4.description: Demonstrate ability to apply the elements of music (i.e., melody, harmony, rhythm, dynamics, form, tone, texture) and principles of composition (e.g., repetition and variation, tension and resolution, balance and unity).

1A9AF536678E4182AF131C81E902B3FC.description: Express musical ideas through composition individually and/or in ensemble settings.

59985F1704814271A71563986E0F8604.description: Explore ways of communicating musical ideas so they can be reproduced by others

5A46A38D99D1442DBC71E8E5616E54A5.description: Compose to express musical ideas developing the use of the elements of music and the principles of composition, respecting cultural contexts.

B46127079BE04E689B50BA0794E3AF35.description: Represent musical ideas using non-standard notation (e.g., abstract symbols and text, timebased pictographs, rap and hip hop flow diagrams with lyrics under beat numbers, braille, colour coded) and/or culture specific forms and models (e.g., unwritten, memorized with fixed and/or variable elements).

43E5933F13E940EFA21B912540F370E6.description: Represent musical ideas using standard notation (i.e., Western music notation, tablature).

AC46440E8D1B447ABAF87E9C06AC5752.description: Explain the legal and ethical implications of music production and distribution.

ABA7C50DE08D488FB6FCC2CEEADB979A.description: Use self and peer assessment to revise, refine and share music through notation.

B699C21DE3914658A1ECD964BDE48253.description: Read and interpret written musical communication of increased complexity.

1D8EE7BE7C5E4329A60673DB596E83FF.description: Demonstrate increased ability to interpret notation to communicate musical ideas (e.g., graphic/invented, tablature, standard and culture-specific forms).

A8C982B128434C23810CBB21EE3FDDBF.description: Demonstrate musicality (e.g., emotional expressiveness) in solo and/or ensemble performance.

01303AD8ECB74C01BC4EE612E9028186.description: Begin making expressive, interpretive and creative choices to communicate and interact with ensemble members and/or audience.

8491F6D371F5406EACA6164CDBADD3D6.description: Track technical development and develop strategies to improve.

D4AC5B68A9DC4AB7A7BB16AA143B5612.description: Demonstrate knowledge of the role of individuals and sections within one’s ensemble by performing the specific tasks particular to one’s instrument.

8FB1DA19CDD54CEE95B97C6FBDF3A796.description: Demonstrate the skills and techniques required for successful ensemble performances.

5DBF78FBE4474713B5898411B6F7E538.description: Generate a plan for musical growth using technical inquiry findings (e.g., in what ways could I/we record progress? How could I improve my musical performance using specific tools, technologies and techniques?).

F5F443F3CC744F33BCD739312D62D710.description: Explain, orally or in writing and using language appropriate to the genre, how the elements of music are used in the music being performed.

8799A310937A4A75903D6BB22D2ED6DD.description: Demonstrate instrumental or vocal technique and knowledge of the elements of music in a peer setting.

873879F275F14C9283CB286113972D68.description: Apply, with guidance, techniques (i.e., instrumental, vocal or creative technologies) and knowledge of the elements of music to solo and/or ensemble performances.

8903CA0C6B844B16A3258CE6E54B956C.description: Creative/Productive (CP) Goal: Students will inquire, create, and communicate through dance, drama, music and visual art.
